Title: The Cosmic Coincidence: Sun, Moon, and Solar Eclipses #shorts #short
Description: Discover the fascinating cosmic coincidence of the sun and moon's sizes and what it means for the future of solar eclipses. Delve into this astronomical marvel in our short, engaging video. #SolarEclipse #Astronomy #CosmicCoincidence

Scenes.VoiceOverText: Did you know the sun is about 400 times wider than the moon, but also 400 times farther away? That's why they look the same size in our sky.
Scenes.Description: Visualization of the sun and moon's relative sizes and distances from Earth.
Scenes.Text: Did you know the sun is about 400 times wider than the moon, but also 400 times farther away? That's why they look the same size in our sky.

Scenes.VoiceOverText: This perfect alignment is what makes total solar eclipses possible. The moon can completely cover the sun, but it's all just a remarkable coincidence.
Scenes.Description: Footage of a total solar eclipse showing the moon covering the sun.
Scenes.Text: This perfect alignment is what makes total solar eclipses possible. The moon can completely cover the sun, but it's all just a remarkable coincidence.

Scenes.VoiceOverText: Interestingly, the moon is slowly drifting away from us, about an inch and a half each year due to tidal interactions with Earth.
Scenes.Description: Animation showing the moon gradually moving away from Earth.
Scenes.Text: Interestingly, the moon is slowly drifting away from us, about an inch and a half each year due to tidal interactions with Earth.

Scenes.VoiceOverText: Eventually, the moon will appear too small in the sky to cover the sun. That means no more total solar eclipses!
Scenes.Description: Graphic depiction of future solar eclipses with the moon not fully covering the sun.
Scenes.Text: Eventually, the moon will appear too small in the sky to cover the sun. That means no more total solar eclipses!

Scenes.VoiceOverText: We've got about a billion years until the last total solar eclipse. So there's still time, but don't wait too long!
